title: I want to be UNBAN!
body:
My account was ban because I was toxic and so on.
SINCE THEN.. I have many accounts ban and just never cared. But now I havent been ban on my new account at all. I mean not even one chat.

Sure I might have come close to one but the fact I havent said it all. It is unfair to say to someone " You are ban. You cannot play this game ever again " for them being toxic and then say to another " You are ban. For being toxic " and not have that ban over turn also.

So since you unban tyler 1 I want my account unban. I am sure others will be lining up as well with there account to be unban also.
Just because someone is popular on twitch and so on does not give them nor any company the right to say to them " Guess what the rules don't matter to you. You get what ever you want because  you have 10,000 followers "
But this guy who has 100.. Fk him him he can stay ban!
Please Riot.. Man up!

replies.body: The easiest way to have your account playable is to not get banned in the first place. /themoreyouknow
I don't think Tyler1 got his account back, i think he just won't be auto banned while streaming by Riot.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=Kf1O51iF,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-01-07T10:17:39.239+0000)
>
> I don't think Tyler1 got his account back, i think he just won't be auto banned while streaming by Riot.

The fact is.. HE WAS BAN AND NOW HE ISNT. 
So to me since he had a LIFE TIME BAN! Meaning he wouldn't ever be allowed to play the game again. He had to change his IP / spoof his IP address to play the game in the first place. If he streamed a game of league that account would be ban.

Me getting my account UNBAN FROM A PERMA BAN is fair!
This is one uphill battle you wont win. Just make peace with it and move on.

> [{quoted}](name=TheDemonEmperor,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=Kf1O51iF,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-07T11:48:38.385+0000)

> This is one uphill battle you wont win. Just make peace with it and move on.

^
But also, Tyler1 didn’t just say
Riot unban me now.
He waited almost 2 years. Totally unrelated but I’m just curious, how did you get bronze in S3/4 plat in season 5 then back to bronze again? Did you you give the account to someone else for a season?
this is what peolpe dont understand{{champion:201}}

If you just ask them to unban you because Tyler1 is unbanned and stuff they won't listen to you. Its like a child whining for a toy because his friend got one (Not comparing you to a child its just an example so don't get mad :) ) 
Try to fix your attitude and be more of a nice person and more people will like you in game and in real life. Im sure the support team is dealing with a lot of people's ban and such and this kind of message will probs get ignored so maybe try writing a sincere message.

If you have seen my post I was quite toxic in the chat and that was my VERY FIRST time being super toxic and it is my very first ban too and i got 14 day ban and next is permanent ban... so i feel really anxious to play rn and learned never to be toxic not even once a while :) 
wish you luck on your account ay

The thing is.. Just like tyler 1 I didnt care because if I was ban I can just go buy another account for like 10 bucks and I am back into it. Ban me now 10 mins later I am playing.

Thats why I never cared about my accounts. But lets take what you said thou.

> If you just ask them to unban you because Tyler1 is unbanned and stuff they won't listen to you. Its like a child whining for a toy because his friend got one (Not comparing you to a child its just an example so don't get mad :) )

That there is the point of it. What you do for one you have to do for all. 
Lets take Blizzard. They have zero-tolerance stance on cheating. If you bot your ban, Map hack your ban.. Do anything they think is unfair your ban. Simple as that.

I have never seen anyone ever that was caught cheating be told " You know what.. Because you have so many followers. We will lift the ban " But Riot has done just that.
Think of how many people Riot has ban for being toxic. Think of how many accounts that have been taken away from a player because they said and I quote this from one of my bans " How much is 1 CS worth? Thats right you and your little butt buddy have no idea how much 1 CS is worth all you worry about is what your dumb little stats say on some web site "

To Riot.. I am toxic and I needed to be ban for saying this. But yet Tyler 1 has said and I quote yet again " I hope you and your family get raped by someone with aids " 

So for Riot to come along and say " Hey you know what tyler.. Because QT / Scarra / Gbay and all them have jumped on your little ban wagon of unban tyler 1. We will. " But because I have 89 sub's on Youtube and not 100,000,00 I cannot get the same thing.

Riot is all about being fair.. Being nice to people.. Up holding the summons code. Then fair is fair Riot. UNBAN MY ACCOUNT AND OTHERS. Only fair you give us a chance to say " I have changed. I can go an month with clean record. "

I mean, i have to admit the way they did it was ... weird.

"play till january and be clean and we will lift the IP ban."

Which is just..... nonsensical, they already can't detect what accounts are his, so there is no real stakes to it.

Not to mention, they actively told him to keep avoiding the ban to get unbanned.

I can see where you are coming from, I don't watch many streamers so I don't know about Tyler1 but if that is true then it is quite unfair and bs. Just like Youtube defending the mighty Paul brothers! But really, should be banned or all unbanned. Even non toxic players gets banned, im not saying about myself but im sure there are some who got banned for no reason.
World now is all about money and popularity isnt it.. smd
Tyler1 went through 2 years of reforming, he deserved his unban.

**Tyler1 didn't get his accounts unbanned**, he was unbanned as a person. 
It means that his new accounts won't be banned on sight. 
He and only one other person have had this type of "banned as a person" thing. 

He won't be getting his old accounts back. 

If we take a look at your bans, they are the standard account ban that do not prevent you from making new ones. These bans only get removed if the ban/punishment was made in error. Considering that you have had multiple accounts banned and have admitted you were toxic, it appears the bans were not in error and will not be removed. If you wish to discuss this more, you can always send in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

Okay.. So lets break this down.
Tyler 1 has so many followers and the cash to pay people like QT / Gbay / Scarra and all them to talk about being unban " as a person " but that makes it automatically right.

As for the support ticket... Yeah send a ticket and get a auto reply from some random bot. Yeah you R MART

I honestly don't understand where you are coming from. 

>**He was banned as a person and now he is not. **
>**He isn't getting his previously banned accounts back, and neither will you. **

People may not agree with someone like T1 being able to play the game again, since he is incredibly high profile and there are a lot of people that behave like he did that to honor him (do you remember the run it down for T1 movement when his in-person ban was announced?). However, he has been given a chance to reform in the public eye, and it looks like he is doing pretty well. Hopefully this will continue and will inspire all his impressionable followers to do the same. 

Your accounts were banned rightfully for toxicity, and the bans won't be taken away. You aren't in person banned. You are simply account banned, there is nothing stopping you from reforming and being part of the community in a more positive manner with a new account.

> [{quoted}](name=Yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=Kf1O51iF,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2018-01-08T23:57:25.923+0000)
>
> Your accounts were banned rightfully for toxicity, and the bans won't be taken away. You aren't in person banned. You are simply account banned, there is nothing stopping you from reforming and being part of the community in a more positive manner with a new account.

That is my point right here.
Your point is that he was person ban. Not account ban. 
They really are the same thing. If I was person ban I would ring my ISP and change my IP address. I can change my system ID.. HECK I can even change my Mac address making tthe so called person ban pointless to being with.

What they have done in fact is allow him to play ONLINE / Stream the game. He is still toxic as he ever was.. Only thing that has changed is the fact he isn't saying it in chat. But this is marked up as fair for him but not for anyone else

How is this justified in anyway... [link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zM6ji0A-zlk) to what I am talking about. I was ban on that account and if riot would pull up the chat log for it. 
I said and I quote this and welcome Riot to prove me wrong with the chat log. What is 1 cs worth..

I owned up someone that was being toxic and I own them with the knowledge of the game.  So please explain to me how it is justified in the idea that Tyler 1 is allowed to be unban but I am not.
Please dont say " You are account ban he isn't " because I have flat out shown how basic and dumb that idea is really. I am not high enough on the Youtube leader to be ban from stream it.

Verbalising your toxic tendencies is a great way to get out your feelings without impacting others in the game. 
I'm pretty toxic myself, and find that it's a good coping mechanism so that I don't create a negative experience for those in game. 

Since those in the game are not privy to his verbal outbursts and lashings, he is not creating a shitty atmosphere to be in. Only those who watch his stream for that very reason (literally his whole gimmick is being insane) are watching it, and yet are not forced to do so which leads me to not understanding when you say:

>What they have done in fact is allow him to play ONLINE / Stream the game. He is still toxic as he ever was.. Only thing that has changed is the fact he isn't saying it in chat. But this is marked up as fair for him but not for anyone else

You have a new account, why don't you just speak out your frustrations instead of taking the time to be a ♥♥♥♥ to your team? 

Person bans and account bans are really not the same thing. There is literally nothing at all stopping you from making new accounts and getting them to level 30 and continuing to play and contribute to the community in a positive manner. 
For him there was. 

When his person ban was issued, they were looking to ban any of his accounts regardless if he was streaming or not. That's kind of the point. They didn't want someone with such big reach and negative behavior to play the game in any capacity. It wasn't an IP ban because like you pointed out, those are easy AF to get around these days, and video game companies do tend to avoid IP bans so they don't screw over PC bangs and such. They were literally tracking Tyler1 as a person, likely through his play patterns (high elo draven 1 tricks are relatively rare) and banning the accounts as they came to notice. 

You owned up to the point of being toxic. 
Good on you. 

You must realize that you were punished, and were actually likely given a warning first to knock off your behavior. You chose not to do so, and now must live with the consequences. 

And just like I have been saying the entire time, Tyler1 was unbanned as a person and can now make accounts to play the game. **His old accounts are forever locked with all the money he and his fans invested in them and will never be released because his punishments were rightfully administered inline with community values. **

>. I was ban on that account and if riot would pull up the chat log for it.
I said and I quote this and welcome Riot to prove me wrong with the chat log. What is 1 cs worth..

If you still have access to your chat logs you are welcome to post them here.

Thank you for the reply and taking the time to explain this more.
Me personally I feel as thou it is completely unfair to let someone like him ever back into the game with the way he acts. I have seen on stream him talking about someone finding this player information and just do anything to get him ban so he has to never see him again ever.

But I can see at this point. We wont see eye to eye nor will I understand how Riot can say " If your good for a month. We won't ban you again " but won't say that to players with ban accounts.
Players like me that have taken the time to do a tyler 1 when you are having a bad game. { AKA scream at the screen } instead of painting a wall of text trying to make that player hate them self for ever playing the game.

So once again thank you for replying and taking the time to post.
Because the lifted ban on Tyler was a *person* ban, not an *account* ban. **None** of his account bans were removed, so why should yours be?

a person ban would be considered higher tier than an account ban yeah. 

so if this celebrity can get a ban, which is worse kind of ban than the average player, lifted eventually, why shouldn't the average player have the possibility of getting account bans (for toxicity) lifted over time (lets say a few seasons/years), providing they can show reform?

this is his point and i would tend to agree with it.

Because when they had that as a thing they did you know what happened? People didn't actually change their behaviour. People would just shut up for the period needed to get their account back, then go right back to being toxic. A permanent ban only has the desired effect if it's actually permanent.

Revoking a *person* ban doesn't give him any special treatment, he still has to follow the same rules as everyone else, and will still get his accounts banned if he goes back to being toxic.

to add to this, if someone was to "shut up for the period they need to get it back" then is that not more effective than your current methods. they stop being toxic for 2 seasons on a new account because there is actually a reason to. low and behold it actually gets rid of toxicity from a true toxic player for that period of time.

it almost becomes like a mute/chat restriction :O :O :O

and this is the big point. have more effective chat restriction and muting and we no longer even have to have conversations about this. the solution is actually brain dead simple. but you lot are too focused on trying to punish people and get back at them and trying to "change their behavior" rather than actually improving the game and environment for everyone else.

firstly, you literally invite people back to the game so what exactly is the difference which account it is on? pretty much proving the point that perm banning for chat in the first place is not the right way.

secondly, you actually have any evidence about the numbers? according to riot only 0.006% of players get perm banned for chat. so the numbers of people getting it back and continuing would be small right?

thirdly, if they misbehave again, then you would punish them again just like you would on a new account and no 2nd chance at recovering that account again.

and it is special treatment, along with professional players that have had bans lifted. those were meant to be permanent also.

I mean, even the drop of the IP bans don't make sense.

"Keep circumventing our ban, and we will stop auto banning you because your actually popular"

**It all comes down to Riot's philosophy that people can reform and that they want to give everyone a chance to. **
It's why there is leniency in leaverbuster and why punishment typically escalates in tiers (except in cases where hate speech and other hot topics appear that the wider community want to stronger punishments).

They realized that even though he was banned as a person, he was going to continue to play League of Legends even if he wasn't streaming it (alas we had the birth of the spectate tyler1 channel). They probably saw this as a "Hey, this dude is a massive jerk but he does have a lot of followers and viewers that are all impressionable young kids. If we give him the chance to properly reform and shed this in-person ban, perhaps all the toxic little kidlets that copy his behaviour will see reforming as "cool" and we will see a decline of tyler1 fanboys getting punished through the system".

>It all comes down to Riot's philosophy that people can reform and that they want to give everyone a chance to. 

Except... they stopped even considering that considering the instant escalations of chat bans for one word offences.

You can't have your cake and stick your dick in it as well.

I had an account perma-banned (256 years) back on NA (before OCE existed).

I'm now 5-6 years without a ban, so I'm proof that players can reform.
